intro: Alyssopsis sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and arrow-shaped, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Alyssopsis sagittata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
